description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 1.1 An enabling environment An enabling environment (knowledge, policy, systems, legislation and budget) created for child and maternal and adolescent survival and development., which contributes to Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition â€“ General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable access and use of high impact reproductive, maternal and neonatal, child and adolescent health and nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 1.1 An enabling environment An enabling environment (knowledge, policy, systems, legislation and budget) created for child andmaternal and adolescent survival and development.
Number of policies, legislative and budgetary instruments developed or revised to ensure realisation of the rights to survival of children and mothers

target.value: 2014:2: eHealth policy and strategic plan, health financing strategy drafted. VHT strategy review underway.

actual.value: 2015:3: e-Health strategy and policy drafts submitted but waiting for finalization, Health financing strategy draft being finalized as part of GoU application to GFF. VHT policy developed and strategy being finalized.

title.narrative: % districts using the mTRAC (integrated in DHIS 2).

target.value: 2014:100%: DHIS2 and mTrac tools fully integrated and scaled up nationally.Reporting rates: DHIS2 90% monthly and mTrac 62% weekly.

actual.value: 2015:100%. DHIS2 and mTrac tools fully integrated and scaled up nationally.

title.narrative: % of planned studies and/or evaluations that were carried out

actual.value: 2015:3, ICCM review, VHT and FHD assessment conducted and findings disseminated
